newsitem.title: USA: TVA shuts Browns Ferry 3 Ala. nuclear power plan.
newsitem.headline: TVA shuts Browns Ferry 3 Ala. nuclear power plan.

text.p: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) has shut down its 1,065 megawatt (MW) Browns Ferry 3 nuclear power plant, the Nuclear Regulatory Administration (NRC) said Monday.
The unit, in Decatur, Ala., was shut after being manually tripped to repair a recirculation pump, the commission said.
TVA Nuclear, which operates the plant, was not immediately available for comment on the problem or when the unit might be brought back on line.
Meanwhile, the Browns Ferry 3 reactor is being kept in hot shutdown mode, which typically indicates the unit is not expected to be down long.
Output at the unit had been fluctuating since it returned to service following a Sept 4 maintenance outage.
It was scheduled to reduce power Friday for a rod reorganization and then ramp up again over the weekend, the company said late last week.
